title: A Tiny Pill That Glows to Check Your Tummy
summary: Scientists have made a special tiny pill that can help doctors see if your tummy is bleeding inside. This pill has tiny living things called bacteria inside it. When the pill goes into your gut, it glows if there is blood. This is important because it can help find problems like gut diseases without hurting you. In tests with mice, it worked well. This could make it easier and faster to know if someone is sick. It's like having a little light inside your body that tells secrets about your health. This new idea might change how we take care of our stomachs in the future.

background_read: The gut is part of our digestive system where food is broken down. Sometimes, people have gut diseases that cause bleeding, which can be hard to find without tests that might be uncomfortable. Scientists are always looking for better ways to check health without causing pain. This new pill uses bacteria that are safe and engineered to glow when they touch blood, making it a friendly tool for doctors to use in the future.
Article_Structure: WHAT: A tiny pill with bacteria that glows to detect gut bleeding
WHERE: In the gut or intestines, tested in mice
WHY: To provide a quick, noninvasive way to monitor gut diseases

perspectives.description: This could help doctors find diseases early without surgery.
